Articles.Content: One of my crazy inventions was an ejection seat w/ Parachute. What's your craziest KSP invention?!

Well I've got two in this one: The craziest landing method ever for an SSTO (which I've used on two planes, but it's much crazier on this one, which is much larger and heavier than the other), and the craziest rover storage/deployment mechanism ever:
Dude that is the coolest SSTO ever!!!

Mine's actually fairly similar to Tiron's, except for two key differences:

1. There's no SSTO spaceplane involved, but that's because

2. I cut out the middle man and just have the rover land itself.

Mine was a reverse Space shuttle that i built for the heck of it. What i mean by reverse space shuttle is that it takes off like a plane and lands like a rocket, which is the opposite of what the space shuttle did. Wings and a bunch of jet engines would bring it up to about 25km, flying around 1500m/s. then the wings would detach and the SRBs that make up most of the rocket would fire sequentially. I got an orbital flight with this design and was attempting to build a Lunar lander version before i lost my save file.

Not sure if it was the most efficient way of doing things though.
